title: German MP wins court case against Meta over fake meme
description: Court obliges Facebook to do more against defamatory posts. A German court on Thursday ordered Meta to do more to combat defamatory posts, rejecting an appeal by the Facebook parent company after a lower court had ruled in favor of the plaintiff.

title: Antifascist eruption in Germany – can it advance?
description: In the wake of mass protests against the fascist-like AfD, the radical left has opportunities to take the initiative, but it must not tail the establishment left, argues Kevin Ovendon Hundreds of thousands of protesters have taken to the streets across Germany for nearly two weeks against the extreme right Alternative for Germany party (AfD).

title: Council to consider policy for maintaining green spaces
description: Cheshire East Council has updated its proposals for how green spaces will be maintained in future in response to feedback from the public. title: Gaza: Hackney Council calls for cessation of hostilities
description: Hackney Council has called for a “cessation of hostilities” in Gaza – with the ruling Labour group admitting that it had a “very, very challenging time” in deciding whether it should support a Green party motion on the issue. Councillors urged an “an immediate and sustainable humanitarian ceasefire on all sides” and for the release of all hostages.

title: Labour unveils candidate looking to take Bedworth seat in General Election
description: Labour has unveiled the candidate who will be looking to take the Bedworth and North Warwickshire seat in the General Election. While no date for the election has yet to be revealed, one is set to be held this year.

title: Budget cuts will cost York's poorest £500 a year, Lib Dems claim
description: On green bins, they say that under their proposals, York tenants on low income and in receipt of council tax support will get a 50 per cent discount on the charge for collecting green bins – so they’d only pay £23.25 a year.

title: DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson steps up with House of Commons speech
description: On Wednesday, that key moment arrived inside the Commons when Sir Jeffrey Donaldson "stepped up" and faced down his challengers both inside and outside his party. It was the moment when the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) leader grabbed hold of the process with both hands and warned his opponents he won't be bullied.
